alert.note: Alert for Aroostook; Penobscot; Piscataquis (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued February 27 at 5:23PM EST until February 27 at 5:45PM EST by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...A SNOW SQUALL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 PM EST FOR CENTRAL PISCATAQUIS...CENTRAL AROOSTOOK AND NORTH CENTRAL PENOBSCOT COUNTIES... At 523 PM EST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from near Portage to near Rockwood, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Near whiteout conditions. Zero visibility in heavy snow and blowing snow. Wind gusts greater than 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel. This includes State Highway 11 between Ashland and Portage. Locations impacted include... Greenville, Ripogenus, Portage, Ashland, Portage Lake, Oxbow, Russel Crossing, South Branch Pond, Lobster Lake, Rockwood, Moosehorn Crossing, Telos Lake, Kokadjo, Northeast Carry, Baxter State Park, Chesuncook, Nashville Plantation, Lobster Township, Frenchtown and Elliottsville. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Travel is not advised during this dangerous snow squall. Rapid visibility reduction and potentially icy roads are likely to lead to accidents. Consider delaying travel until the squall passes your location. If traveling, pull off to a safe location and turn your headlights on.
